title: Hayward Universal H-Series Digital (HFDN) — Guided Troubleshooting
description: Guided diagnostic flow for Hayward Universal H-Series Digital gas heaters (HFDN/FDN models with LCD display). Uses onboard error codes and voltage checks to isolate faults.

enter_code.text: Select the error code currently displayed on the heater:

code_ao.text:
AO = Blower vacuum switch open when it should be closed.

Check:
- Does the blower start?
- Verify vacuum hose to switch is connected and clear.
- During blower run, check continuity across vacuum switch — should be CLOSED (0 Ω).

If open, replace the blower vacuum switch.

code_ac.text:
AC = Blower vacuum switch closed when it should be open.

Possible stuck or shorted pressure switch. Disconnect one lead and test continuity — should read OPEN when blower is off.

code_if.text:
IF = Ignition failure.

Check:
- Igniter receives 120 VAC during ignition attempt.
- Verify gas supply and pressure.
- Flame sensor clean and positioned properly.
- Check flame rectification current ≥ 1.5 µA DC.

If all checks pass and code persists → replace ignition control board.

code_hs.text:
HS = High limit or overheat detected.

Check for:
- Restricted water flow or dirty filter.
- Faulty high-limit sensor (should read closed under 135 °F).

If open circuit persists when water is cool → replace high-limit sensor.

code_lo.text:
LO = Water pressure or limit switch fault.

Check:
- Ensure pump is on and system is primed.
- Test pressure switch for continuity with pump running — should be CLOSED.
- If open, clean/replace filter or switch.

code_pf.text:
PF = Polarity or low voltage fault.

Check:
- Verify correct line and neutral wiring.
- Confirm ground connection to heater chassis.
- Measure line voltage (should be 120 V ± 10%).

If polarity correct and voltage stable, replace control board.

code_ce.text:
CE = Communication error between display and control board.

Check ribbon cable connection between main board and display.
Inspect for corrosion or pin damage.

If connection good but code persists → replace display interface.

code_ee.text:
EE = Control board fault.

Cycle power to reset. If error returns immediately, replace main control board.

code_hf.text:
HF = Flame detected when gas valve not energized.

Check:
- Flame signal wire shorted to ground.
- Gas valve stuck open or leaking.
- Replace gas valve if voltage absent but flame detected.

code_sf.text:
SF = Temperature sensor (thermistor) failure.

Check resistance of inlet and outlet sensors:
- 77 °F ≈ 10 kΩ
- 104 °F ≈ 6 kΩ

If reading out of range or open, replace affected sensor.

replace_vacuum_switch.text: Replace blower vacuum (pressure) switch. Ensure tubing and fittings are free of debris or water after installation.

replace_ignition_control.text: Replace ignition control board. Verify correct wiring and retry ignition sequence.

replace_pressure_switch.text: Replace water pressure switch and verify proper water flow through heater.

replace_high_limit.text: Replace high-limit sensor(s) and confirm normal temperature cutoff near 135 °F.

replace_board.text: Replace main control board. Reconnect wiring and retest system.

replace_display.text: Replace display interface assembly (front control). Ensure communication cable is properly seated.

replace_gas_valve.text: Replace gas valve and perform leak check before restarting heater.

replace_sensor.text: Replace defective temperature sensor (thermistor) and confirm normal readings at room temperature.

end_success.text: ✅ Fault cleared. Heater operating normally after corrective action.

end_other.text: If no code displayed or issue persists, document findings and contact Hayward Technical Support for further diagnosis.
